parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3 </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>0.50</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Arguments</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> local </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Effects</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Radio and Chat </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr2</name>=<value> Sounds </value></part><part><name>GROUP2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr3</name>=<value> Custom Radio and Chat </value></part><part><name>GROUP3</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Sends the message to the custom radio channel. The message is defined in the [[description.ext]] file or radio protocol.  </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> unit '''customRadio''' [customChannelID, message] </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> unit: [[Object]]  </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> customChannelID: [[Number]] - [[Channel IDs|custom channel ID]] returned by [[radioChannelCreate]] command </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER3</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> message: [[String]]  </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER4</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value> 


</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_soldierOne [[customRadio]] [1, "WordEnemy"];</code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value> 

____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[radioChannelCreate]], [[customChat]], [[sideRadio]], [[groupRadio]], [[vehicleRadio]], [[globalRadio]], [[directSay]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name index="7"/><value>  </value></part><part><name>MPBEHAVIOUR</name>=<value> 
____________________________________________________________________________________________
</value></part></template>

[[Category:Scripting Commands Arma 3|<template><title>uc:<template><title>PAGENAME</title></template></title></template>]]
[[Category:Scripting Commands|<template><title>uc:<template><title>PAGENAME</title></template></title></template>]]

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on December 3, 2016 - 21:35 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Killzone Kid|Killzone Kid]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
To transmit user custom sounds (see [[Multiplayer_Custom_Sounds_Tutorial]]), prefix the full filename including file extension with #. For example if there is a custom user sound file called <tt>MySound.ogg</tt>, to play it on the radio use:
<code>[[player]] [[customRadio]] [1, "#MySound.ogg"];</code> 
</dd>
</dl>
